thread.title: Twitter reacts to Utah defeating Arizona State 34-18
thread.title_full: Twitter reacts to Utah defeating Arizona State 34-18

author: Holli Joyce, KSL.com Contributor
title: Twitter reacts to Utah defeating Arizona State 34-18
text:
Twitter reacts to Utah defeating Arizona State 34-18 By Holli Joyce, KSL.com Contributor | Posted Oct 18th, 2015 @ 1:29am 0 
SALT LAKE CITY — 42 years. 
That's how long it's been since Utah has defeated Arizona State at home. Let alone the team has never won versus the team down south as conference rivals. The Utes (6-0, 3-0 Pac-12) came into Saturday's matchup against the Sun Devils (4-3, 2-2) with a different result in mind. 
It wasn't pretty by any means, but the Utes faced adversity and won 34-18. Utah officially became bowl eligible and keeps its undefeated season with the victory, sitting high on the peak of Pac-12 football. 
The first quarter was rough for the Utes. Arizona State led 10-7 at the end of it, but Utah started the second quarter with a bang. In what is arguably the catch of the year, Travis Wilson found Kenneth Scott for a 42-yard first down completion. Scott, nicknamed Batman, caught the ball with one hand and left Rice-Eccles Stadium — and the nation — in complete awe. SportsCenter Top 10, anyone? — Utah Athletics (@utahathletics) October 18, 2015 Kenneth Scott right now. pic.twitter.com/9nLGlu0zGb — Avery Mills (@alynn422) October 18, 2015 Kenneth Scott's catch was one of the best of the year. 
Don't fix what isn't broken, right? Utah thought so as Wilson threw to Scott on the next play for an 11-yard touchdown. Scott finished the night as the Utes' leading receiver with 116 yards on five catches. That drive brought to you by @Kscott_2 — It's Trav (@__Trav_) October 18, 2015 K Scott on  — Sinnie (@JazDodgerUteGal) October 18, 2015 
Special teams had an uncharacteristic performance. The turning point of the game came when Britain Covey caught a punt return in the end zone. In a failed trick play, he passed an illegal forward pass to Bubba Poole in the end zone, resulting in a safety to put the Sun Devils up 15-14. It left Ute Nation with frustration and rightfully so. Stop trying to be cute and play football.
